index.html.title: uuups Documentation
index.html.contents: View Project Uuups – experimental WordPress Theme Uuups is an experiment how to bring your theme to the next level. This is playground from two starter themes: Justin Tadlock’s starter theme Mine starter theme called Foxer All the ideas are still open and there are no documentation. Demo Demo can be seen in Foxland site. My wishlist I have hopes and dreames for the starter theme: Accessibility ready out of the box. Clean semantic HTML without lots of extra DIVs Scalable, modular CSS/SASS architecture. It should guide developers how they write their CSS. Ready for Gutenberg and a maximum WYSIWYG experience. ES6 for JavaScript. Gulp, Webpack, or npm scripts for automated tasks like - compiling assets. optimising images and SVGs. CSS, JS, and PHPCS linting. SVG system. being design system ready. Directory structure Directory structure aims to be modern app-like, what ever that means :) resources folder is for editing theme for your needs. This is where the most of the magic happens. resources/views have all the template structure and partials files. resources/styles have SASS files. resources/scripts have JS files. resources/svg-icons have SVG icons. resources/lang have language files. app folder is for theme related functions and classes. Classes are loaded automatically but functions-files needs to be added manually via functions.php. dist folder has processed and optimized assets ready to be included to theme. Do not edit or add anything to dist folder. It is processed automatically via task tools like Webpack or Gulp. Installation and setup Starter theme uses Composer and NPM to manage its dependencies. Install both on your machine before using this starter theme. Theme has Hybrid Core 5.0 as a must have dependency. Setup script We should have setup script that handles all the search/replace. Or similar how Tonik can be installed via composer. Creating new theme WordPress themes lives in the wp-content/themes folder. This is where we fetch our starter theme files. # Go to the `themes` directory of your WordPress installation. $ cd wp-content/themes You can download files from this repo or clone the repository to the wp-content/themes directory. $ git clone -b master git@github.com:samikeijonen/uuups.git <theme-name> Make sure you’re in the root folder of your theme. $ cd <theme-name> Install composer dependencies. $ composer install Install node dependencies. $ npm install Active theme Activate your theme under Appearance > Themes. Or use WP-CLI to activate your theme. wp theme activate <theme-name> Gulp tasks Note that ABC theme have webpack. In this theme experiment I still use Gulp tasks for automated processes. Run gulp watch to activate build process in the background. You’ll get development proxy at http://localhost:3000 where changes to the code will be updated automatically to browser. All tasks: gulp watch – Automatically handle changes to CSS, JS, SVGs, and images. Also kicks off BrowserSync. gulp scripts – Minify javascript files from resources/scripts/ to dist/scripts/. gulp styles – Compile, prefix, combine media queries, and minify CSS files from resources/styles/ to dist/styles/. gulp icons – Minify and clean SVG icons and create SVG sprite from resources/svg-icons/*.svg to dist/images/svg-icons.svg. gulp i18n – Scan the theme and create a POT file toresources/lang/ folder. gulp sass:lint – Run SASS against WordPress coding standards. gulp js:lint – Run Javascript against WordPress coding standards. gulp docs – Create SASS docs which can be seen in Uuups Github pages. gulp imagemin – Compress images from resources/images/ to dist/images/. gulp – Run tasks in this order: i18n, icons, styles, scripts, imagemin, docs. You can configure Gulp related settings in the gulp-config.js file. It’s needed if you want to change files names or folder structure.

mixins.html.title: mixins
mixins.html.contents: @mixin font-size() Generates a rem font-size and a baseline-compatible unitless line-height from font-size value. You can also modify the line-height by increments, while staying in the baseline grid, by setting the $modifier parameter. It takes a positive or negative number, and it will add or remove “lines” to the generated line-height. This is the recomended way to do it, unless you really need an absolute value. It is recommended to only add or subtract full integers or half steps. Parameters & Return $font-size: (number) $line-height: auto (number) Line height $modifier: 0 (number) Line modifier @error #{$font-size} needs to be a number. @error D’oh! #{$line-height} is not a valid value for $line-height. Examples scss Example 1: @include font-size(1.25rem); scss Example 2, force line-height: @include font-size(1rem, 1.5); scss Example 3, add 2 lines: @include font-size(2rem, $modifier: +2); scss Example 4, subtract -0.5 lines: @include font-size(0.875rem, $modifier: -0.5); Requires $global-font-size @mixin center() Center any element. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .center { @include center; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .center { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; } Used By @mixin center-block() @mixin center-block() Center any block element. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .center-block { @include center-block; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .center-block { display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; } Requires @mixin center() Resets margin and padding on any element. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .foo { @include reset-margin-padding; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .foo { margin: 0; padding: 0; } Used By @mixin reset-list() @mixin reset-list() Reset all padding and styles on both unordered and ordered lists. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .reset-list { @include reset-list; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .reset-list { list-style-type: none; margin: 0; padding: 0; } Requires @mixin reset-margin-padding() @mixin global-transition() Global transition. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .transition { @include global-transition; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .transition { transition: all 300ms ease-in-out; } Requires $transition-duration-1 @mixin global-box-shadow() Global transition. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .box-shadow { @include global-box-shadow; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .box-shadow { box-shadow: 0 0.5rem 2rem rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1); } Requires $global-spacing-unit-1 @mixin button-block() Button styles. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .button { @include button-block; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .button { background-color: #222; border: none; color: #fff; padding: 1.5rem; } Requires $global-spacing-unit-1 @mixin button-block-hover() Button hover styles. Examples scss Basic Usage Sass .button:hover, .button:focus { @include button-block-hover; } css Basic Usage CSS Output .button:hover .button:focus { background-color: #111; }

undefined.html.title: General
undefined.html.contents: embed, iframe, object scss embed, iframe, object { max-width: 100%; } Make sure embeds and iframes fit their containers. img scss img { height: auto; max-width: 100%; // Removes the whitespace under img, safer than `display: block;`. vertical-align: middle; } Make sure images are scaled correctly. .screen-reader-text scss .screen-reader-text { border: 0; clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px); clip-path: inset(50%); height: 1px; margin: -1px; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; position: absolute; width: 1px; // Many screen reader and browser combinations announce broken words // as they would appear visually. word-wrap: normal !important; &:focus { @include font-size(0.875rem); background-color: $color-base; clip: auto !important; clip-path: none; color: $color-white; display: block; font-weight: 700; height: auto; left: $global-spacing-unit-1; padding: $global-spacing-unit-1 $global-spacing-unit-2; text-decoration: none; top: $global-spacing-unit-1; width: auto; // Above WP toolbar. z-index: 100000; } } Text meant only for screen readers.

variables.html.title: variables
variables.html.contents: Baseline grid lines height is so called 8 point grid. Every spacing metric should be based on this. Inspired by inuitcss. Related : https://github.com/inuitcss/inuitcss $global-factor-1 scss $global-factor-1: 1 !default; How many grid lines should our spacing unit variants span? Each value should be an unitless integer. $global-spacing-unit-1 scss $global-spacing-unit-1: $global-baseline * $global-factor-1 !default; Spacing values are determined based on your project’s global baseline grid. It is not recommended that you modify these following variables (it can break your vertical rhythm), but if you need to, you can. Used By @mixin global-box-shadow() @mixin button-block() $global-font-size scss $global-font-size: 1rem !default; Base typographical styles. Global font size. Used By @mixin font-size() $global-line-height scss $global-line-height: ($line-height / $global-font-size) !default; Global line height. $max-width-1 scss $max-width-1: $global-spacing-unit-3 * 42 + 2 * $global-spacing-unit-3; Max widths. $breakpoint-1 scss $breakpoint-1: 48em; Breakpoints. $transition-duration-1 scss $transition-duration-1: 300ms; Transition Used By @mixin global-transition() $columns scss $columns: ( 1: 100%, 2: 50%, 3: 33.33%, 4: 25%, 5: 20%, 6: 16.66%, 7: 14.28%, 8: 12.5%, 9: 11.11% ); Columns for old gallery markup.
